content: According to beck it is. We are going to be in a depression with or without inflation. I can't help but to think had we had the fairtax 5 years ago and a system based on we only spend it if we got it, we may have been saved. Times would have been rough, but at least it would have been saved. I think it is too late and the world is going to turn it's back on the dollar bill. Wonder what a world money will look like...hopefully it will have the Stars and Stripes on it some where. I have to ask myself again, who gave the Fed the power to steer us in to an economic meltdown... "http://www.glennbeck.com/content/articles/article/198/22954/"

content: Enough with this stupid depression talk....If some "cabal" somewhere wanted that it would have happen last year... What needs to be discussed are the isues of Social Security and Medicare.... We spend 600billion on Social Security, over 500billion on Medicare, and almost another 600billion on defense(not counting the costs of the wars) every year... What are we willing to give up?

content: quote: I don't see that "75 bucks" rise? In fact gold is "flat," actually a bit down. That's because you are not paying attention. The gold shot up 75 points March 18th, I beleive, when feds announced that they were gonna buy as much as $300 billion in government debt. Just checked the charts. More like 50 something points in a matter of hours. But still it was a sharp and suddent jump. The question I have, is, are we going to have hyperinflation or not?

content: I agree with Sunliner.... with all this money being printed, the value is dropping.. yepper, depression is coming..may be a good thing in some respects. Our young folks will need to learn that washing dishes, picking apples or digging a ditch isn't such a bad thing after all. And their expectations of 40K out of high school is not, nor ever was, a reality. Most of us had depression era parents who tried to teach us the value of a dollar and how to earn it...... wellllllll, it looks like the pendulum swings once more. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: According to beck it is. We are going to be in a depression with or without inflation. I can't help but to think had we had the fairtax 5 years ago and a system based on we only spend it if we got it, we may have been saved. Times would have been rough, but at least it would have been saved. I think it is too late and the world is going to turn it's back on the dollar bill. Wonder what a world money will look like...hopefully it will have the Stars and Stripes on it some where. I have to ask myself again, who gave the Fed the power to steer us in to an economic meltdown... "http://www.glennbeck.com/content/articles/article/198/22954/"

quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Enough with this stupid depression talk....If some "cabal" somewhere wanted that it would have happen last year... What needs to be discussed are the isues of Social Security and Medicare.... We spend 600billion on Social Security, over 500billion on Medicare, and almost another 600billion on defense(not counting the costs of the wars) every year... What are we willing to give up? I'd be willing to give up all three.
reply: I would not be willing to give up our Military dominance....Social Security has got to go. Whether President Obama does it or not, someone some day is going to have to throw the baby boomers under the bus for the great good... For the Greater Good.....

title: Economic Game Over?

content: quote: Originally posted by SUNLINER81: quote: Originally posted by TataH: quote: I don't see that "75 bucks" rise? In fact gold is "flat," actually a bit down. That's because you are not paying attention. The gold shot up 75 points March 18th, I beleive, when feds announced that they were gonna buy as much as $300 billion in government debt. Just checked the charts. More like 50 something points in a matter of hours. But still it was a sharp and suddent jump. The question I have, is, are we going to have hyperinflation or not? If President Obama just turns on the presses, then we will, if the government can secure loans to back President Obama's spending then no... The problem is, right now no one is willing to take our "paper"... It's either depression and on shore our industry, enact trade tariffs or face depression with hyper inflation when we just "willy nilly" print currency... Look out Germany at the end of the first world war... Respectfully, SUNLINER81 Beck is an idiot. Gold fluctuates all the time. To post "one" rise, and make believe it's unique is some sort of fantasy. Here's a 30 day chart - Once again with permission of the site... Gold isn't even up to previous values set at the beginning of the month. And Gold spikes and drops all the time. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by 10tenths: quote: Originally posted by freakzilla60: I think everyone here should read up on Milton Friedman, Ludwig von Mises, maybe Stephen Moore or any CLASSICAL liberal (if you don't know what that means, please look it up before flaming), so you can shudder when you think back on how dumb you must have sounded. I go to the Mises Institute website daily. So much to read in there. I could spend days digging through that site. Oh, wait. I already do. Milton Friedman is a reliable source? This crazed lunatic advocated abolishing ALL controls on Banks and Finance. According to him the market is "self regulating." Which is true if you don't mind living with thirty percent unemployment for ten year stretches. And his philosophy created an SEC which had no teeth and no interest in getting any teeth. Bernie Madoffs are "self regulating." - But ask his customers if they will appreciate that. Dave
